Controllers Module¶

The controllers module contains the business logic for handling different resources in the application, such as tenants, rooms, roles, and more. Each controller file is responsible for a specific resource or group of resources.

Files in the controllers module:¶

  • administrator_handler.py: Handles requests related to administrators.

  • auth_handler.py: Handles authentication-related requests.

  • dormitory_handler.py: Handles requests for dormitory data.

  • parameter_handler.py: Handles requests for parameter data.

  • parameter_room_handler.py: Handles requests for parameter room data.

  • relationship_handler.py: Handles relationships between resources.

  • role_handler.py: Handles role-related requests.

  • room_handler.py: Handles room-related requests.

  • shelter_handler.py: Handles shelter-related requests.

  • tenant_handler.py: Handles tenant-related requests.

  • tenant_relationship_handler.py: Handles relationships between tenants and other resources.

Description:¶

This module is responsible for mapping requests to functions that interact with the database and return the appropriate data to the user.

Administrator Handler¶

class app.controllers.administrator_handler.Administrator_Controller(db: object)¶

Bases: object

Controller for managing administrator-related operations.

This class handles the creation, updating, deletion, retrieval, and authentication of administrators in the database.

create_administrator(body: AdministratorCreate)¶

Creates a new administrator in the database.

Parameters:

body (models.AdministratorCreate) – An object containing the administrator data to create.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and response data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

delete_administrator(body: AdministratorDelete)¶

Deletes an administrator from the database.

Parameters:

body (models.AdministratorDelete) – An object containing the administrator ID to delete.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and deleted administrator data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

get_admin_by_username(username: str)¶

Retrieves an administrator by their username.

This method queries the database for an administrator based on the provided username and returns the details.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the administrator to retrieve.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and administrator data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

get_all()¶

Retrieves all administrators from the database.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and administrator data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

healthz()¶

Checks the status of the connection.

Returns:

A dictionary with the status “ok”.

Return type:

dict

update_administrator(body: AdministratorUpdate)¶

Updates an existing administrator in the database.

Parameters:

body (models.AdministratorUpdate) – An object containing the updated administrator data.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and updated administrator data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

Authentication Handler¶

class app.controllers.auth_handler.Auth_Controller(db: object)¶

Bases: object

A controller for handling authentication operations like login.

db¶

An instance of a database (e.g., Nexus1DataBase) that will be used for database operations.

Type:

object

login(form_data: fastapi.security.OAuth2PasswordRequestForm)¶

Authenticates a user by verifying their username and password.

This method checks if the provided username exists in the database and if the password matches the stored (hashed) password. If successful, it generates and returns an access token for the user.

Parameters:

form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The credentials provided by the user for login.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token and token type if authentication is successful.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the credentials are invalid, an HTTP 401 Unauthorized exception is raised.

Dormitory Handler¶

class app.controllers.dormitory_handler.Dormitory_Controller(db: object)¶

Bases: object

Controller for managing dormitory-related operations.

This class handles the creation, updating, deletion, and retrieval of dormitories in the database.

create_dormitory(body: DormitoryCreate)¶

Creates a new dormitory in the database.

This method takes a DormitoryCreate object, which contains the necessary data to create a dormitory and saves it to the database.

Parameters:

body (models.DormitoryCreate) – An object containing the dormitory data to create.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and response data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

delete_dormitory(body: DormitoryDelete)¶

Deletes a dormitory from the database.

This method takes a DormitoryDelete object, which contains the ID of the dormitory to delete.

Parameters:

body (models.DormitoryDelete) – An object containing the dormitory ID to delete.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and deleted dormitory data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

get_all()¶

Retrieves all dormitories from the database.

This method queries all dormitory records in the database and returns them.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and dormitory data.

Return type:

ResponseModel

healthz()¶

Checks the status of the connection.

This method returns a “ok” status message indicating that the API is working correctly.

Returns:

A dictionary with the status “ok”.

Return type:

dict

update_dormitory(body: DormitoryUpdate)¶

Updates an existing dormitory in the database.

This method takes a DormitoryUpdate object, which contains the updated data for the dormitory, and updates the corresponding record in the database.

Parameters:

body (models.DormitoryUpdate) – An object containing the updated dormitory data.

Returns:

A response model with the status of the operation, message, and updated dormitory data.

Return type:

ResponseModel
